description:
Wine jar is the best.  Love this place. 

Jeff the bartender is so friendly and knowledgeable. The atmosphere is romantic and so cute. The wine list is a 10 out of 10!
author: Jessica T.

description: The one thing beautiful Fillmore street was lacking was a nice little neighborhood wine bar. Or so I thought until I stumbled upon this gem. It's so cute, has patio seating and great happy hour specials. Fun for a group or you can go in solo because you'll definitely walk out with new friends. They also have live jazz on Sunday's. Adding to my list of neighborhood faves for sure.
author: Lauren P.

description: Service is astonishingly bad and the bartender is rude.  We went last night for a drink and won't be returning.  The bartender actually spent the WHOLE time talking to a friend at the bar.  The bar was virtually empty but he couldn't be bothered to serve us.  I can honestly say that this is the worst bar I've been to in San Francisco.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I went there on a week night and my friends and I absolutely loved this place!
It has nice cozy tables. The wine was great. We also tried the dry fruit which was decent. The staff was very nice and helpful. Overall the place seemed very chill. 
(It was election night when we went there)
author: Arjan N.

description: My favorite wine bar in the city! Amazing wine selection with light snacks. Big plus is the non-douchey crowd. Super friendly & accommodating without being pushy. Very generous with the refills. Great place for date night. My only (and this is a tiny one) complaint is the uncomfortable wooden seating in the booth area.  But that's mostly because I'm a shorty. Otherwise awesome place!
author: Carina R.

description: Great little wine bar for a pre-dinner drink.  Staff were super helpful, and even provided a tasting when we weren't sure between the Pinot Gris and Pinot Grigio.  Excellent selection of wine too.
author: Vanessa H.

description: This is my favorite wine bar in SF! The wait staff is welcoming and friendly. The wine selection is very good with some unique choices. I like that it is a neighborhood bar so a lot of locals come in and it seems like everyone knows each other. Like Cheer, but a wine bar! I love the fact that they usually have sports on the TV because just because I am drinking wine doesn't mean that I don't want to sometimes feel like I am in a sports bar lol. Overall the best place in town and I highly recommend checking it out!
author: Sean P.

description:
First and last time at this bar. The service was not very good and the waiter not friendly. Who walks away while you're asking questions?
Also, my French accent doesn't mean I'm a tourist so you can keep your 18% automatically gratuity to yourself. The customers must be notified of this fact, usually by having it be printed on the menu, and this was nowhere to be found on their menu. The waiter ignored our request to take the automatic gratuity off the check and walked away with our credit card. 1 star is way too generous.
author: Morgan L.

description: We had our engagement party here and It was perfect. Jeff was a delight to work with - he kept the wine flowing and was extremely accommodating. We've been here a ton for a nice night out, but it was a great place for a private party. The wines are delicious and the atmosphere is cozy and upscale. Come here and have a great time while supporting a great establishment.
author: Chuck D.

description: So I can see from a lot of other reviews that the service is the problem at this bar (I was also turned off by a weird perfumy smell that interfered with my wine palate and the stained dirty menus) and I concur. We were very begrudgingly given a taste of two wines, didn't like either and opted for another that wasn't so great either. So I would like to offer the server a glimpse into a different world where people will love this place. Here's the script: "Hi, my name's Rick. Welcome to the Wine Jar. We have some really interesting wines we're featuring right now. What kind of wine do you like to drink? OK, let me give you a taste of this one and this one to see which one you like." Satisfied customer, willing to pay $14 for a great glass of wine and not feel like someone is doing them a favor!
author: Luke A.

description: This is a great little spot on a quiet block of Fillmore Street. It tends to be relatively quiet - a good place to come for a date or to catch up with a friend. There are also more open seating areas so it's a good place for a group as well.
author: Emily F.

description:
Late afternoon is a nice time to head over to this neighborhood bar, with nice outdoor seating and not too shabby of interior decor. Good selection of wine. If you happen to arrive before 5:30 or some time around there, you get somewhat a discount, I think.

We sat by the bar and caught up before dinner. The lady was very attentive. He wanted to know if they had red screw top because he's finishing up his elder kid's costume and needed it. She made a switch between a white and red bottle and handed the cap. Just like that.

I asked for a napkin to spit out of my gum, before I realized it was slipped under my glass. It's that kind of attentive service makes this wine bar special. I suspect it is a good spot for afternoon rendezvous. As we were leaving, a few other patrons started to trickle in.
author: Victoria E.

description: Stopped in on a Saturday and it wasn't crowded so got a booth. It was quiet and the bartender was attentive and helped answer questions. Good, dark and quite vibe overall.
author: Matthew v.

description: Great date spot or just to meet up with friends for a quiet spot to catch up. The owner, Jeff, is a handsome bartender who is there most nights - and very friendly. The bartendress, Lara, is always willing to recommend her favorites and chat. Sexy interior with great lighting and interesting artwork. My favorite local spot!
author: Julia K.

description:
Stumbled upon this place after dinner on a cold evening, and I was welcomed by the warmth and coziness of this place.

However, I thought it was just the wrong night or the wrong time, but a bad service seems to be a common theme for most customers of this wine bar. The bartender was not welcoming or friendly at all. My friend and I sat at the bar and ordered a bottle of wine, she literally almost just dumps the wine into the glasses... hence, killing my appetite. I mean she works at a wine bar, can't she pour it better? At least, put a smile on your face, will ya?

Besides the bad experience with the unfriendly bartender, the place itself is actually pretty nice. I like the whole intimate ambiance and the wine selection. It is a perfect place for a small date or catching up with few friends, if the bartender wasn't there.

Wine Selection: A-
Ambiance: A+
Service: D
author: Solongo B.

description:
Wine Jar is pretty ok. 

It's a spot in Lower Pacific Heights that you can typically find a place to sit when all the rest of the bars in the area are packed. 

The service has always been fine / but not overly helpful. And they serve water in plastic cups... at a wine bar.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday evening to catch up with a high school friend because it was hard to find low noise level joints for decent conversation and drinks in the area.  There were relatively less people compared to other bars and atmosphere was perfect.  We got our own booth which was nice but it was too big for our party of three.  Probably good for groups of 6. Cozy and roomy at the same time.  Decent prices for bottles of wine to share, especially during their happy hour, 20% off bottles.

Get your food to go from neighboring restaurants and come here to enjoy it with friends.  Only three stars because of low selection and variety on snacking option.
author: Naty D.

description:
Cute bar - but bad service ruins it.
Question about wine may I taste these 2? -- we don't do tastes!
Ask for a glass of water-- get a plastic cup!
Ask for the bill, he tells you the amount, expecting what?!?!?

Sad - the place needs a great waitress/ waiter and they would be crowded!
author: Carolin H.

description: Cute spot but the wine itself is mediocre.  The wine by the glass always tastes like the bottle has been sitting out for days.  I wanted to think that I just kept ordering the wrong wine, but after this kept happening, I gave up on this place.
author: Roberta V.

description:
The waiter seemed more interested by his friends at the bar and the basketball game rather than serving us. 
I was also very disappointed with the cheese plate !
author: Stéphanie G.

description:
I was wearing 3.5 inches high heels when I walked by this place with my friends. This was a life saver because I just needed a place to sit down. We walked by couple restaurants, but they all smell stinky for some reasons. This cute wine bar is perfect. The is a double love-seats sofas in the middle of the room. Another small cozy private room and a row of nice high chairs by the bar. 

We ordered "Domaine Girard 2012 Chardonnay" from France. It's $35 per bottle. It's a very light citrusy smooth white wine. Good for after a heavy meal. 

Overall I really like this place and will come by when I     am done with shopping on the Fillmore St. Next time.
author: Candy C.

description:
Barbera is my new favorite red!

How do I know? Because I tried it at the Wine Jar. 

After a movie we drifted in here on our way to dinner.  Because hey, wine bars are cool, and it was open!  Didn't want to pass it up and wait 3 years for another chance. 

Inside there were some window seats, a couple of banquettes, one in a booth, and a bunch of bar seats. We chose a banquette setting outside the booth.  A cheerful waitstaffperson (it's SF, OK?) informed us that while some of the menu items might be out of stock, any substitution would be the same varietal. 

All right. Our choices ran from a glass at $11 to a bottle around $120. Something for every taste, right?  We started with some sparkling wines; mine was a prosecco that was not sweet at all.  So much for past experience and stereotypes!  This prosecco I would classify as brut and it was delicious!  

Round two for me was a barbera and, oops, here came the substitution. But the sommelier or bartender or wino authority in the back room obviously had taste!  Smooth is only the beginning of this wine. It had legs and body and no aftereffects. Except maybe I'm a little tipsy now; there's a reason I observe a 2 drink limit these days. 

Conversation around our table was congenial  and intimate. Conversation at a nearby table sounded like a first date. This brought me to reflect that even in my single years, I was not a dater. More power to you,  brave singles! 

Our tab for 4 glasses was $52 + tip. Our gratitude to the waitstaffperson for her friendly advice, and then it was on to dinner. 

Wine. Try it. Let the experts on site guide you, and you may find a new favorite.
author: David D.

description:
Having worked in Pac Heights for some time now, I can't believe I didn't know about this place...

Especially when you're in the mood for a glass of wine - after a long day of work - this helps wonders.

I reccomend coming by during their happy hour - 20% off on all their bottles of wine.

I tried out the Pinot Noir Russian River and it was perfect. 

Will definitely swing by again soon.
author: Sam K.

description: This place sucks. Service is beyond horrible. Bartender gives no suggestions or recommendations and obviously doesn't know her wines. She's a pourer that's it. There are much better places to go on Fillmore such as Elite Cafe or Florio for a great glass of wine with great service. Don't go here especially if the blonde "bartender" is working.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Great neighborhood spot with good wine selection, service and music.  I live in the neighborhood so come pretty frequently and always enjoy it. Lastly, very very reasonably priced for SF, especially in comparison to a lot of the marina wine spots.
author: Shawn C.

description:
This place is 'Meh'. Went here last night after dinner and ordered a $50 bottle of wine and asked for some waters. The waiter actually threw one water on the table and stalked off. The wine was good though- we got the Experience Cab. Nothing was going on and no one  was really in the bar and the service sucked, so we just left.
So much wasted potential since the place is actually really charming and has a good wine selection.
author: Monica C.

description:
I've been on a wine kick lately. It's the elegance of it, the subtlety of its flavors, the richness of the reds and the clarity of the whites, the internationalism of it all. Wine exemplifies how I want my life to be: elegant with a hint of booze.

Wine Jar is the best place for wine on Fillmore. They serve a good selection in glasses and bottles (with discounts during happy hour), and offer a food menu as well.

Whether you're on a date for two or just for one, you can't go wrong with Wine Jar.
author: Keane L.

description: The ambiance is nice, the wine was decent but nothing special. We tried the cheese plate and it was very underwhelming, it was about 10% nothing-special cheese, 90% cheap crackers and mixed nuts. Our bartender was incredibly rude. I don't think we'll be coming back.
author: Sofia F.

description: It's a tiny place for groups and doesn't have too many staff to accommodate customers. The bartender was really nice and the atmosphere was cool.
author: Orange G.

description:
Came here on a whim with a few friends before dinner. we saw "HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS" on a sandwich board outside, so we decided to check it out. 

For happy hour, i felt it was kinda of pricey. The  guys ordered a beer for 3 bucks? Which was ok priced. However, when we asked the bartender (wine-tender? lol) which beer was a red ale, she said i dont know. i only drink the wine. sorry. lol. alright i understand that its a wine bar, and u should be an expert in it. But! at the same time, you should know all the products that you offer. I mean there was only like 5 kinds of beer, if u can memorize what all the hundreds of wines are like, those 5 beers shouldnt be hard for u.lol. so the guys ended up just picking random ones. lol

We asked about the prices for wine for happy hour. there wasnt any by the glass. and its just 20% off a bottle. ehhhhhhhh. lol. the menu indicated flight specials. so we asked what that was. lo and hold, specials by the glass (well kinda) so 3 of us split the flight ($15 dollars for 3  glasses). It was kinda pricey given the amount she gave us. it was probably a 3oz pour at most. iono, i just didnt feel like it was worth it.

the wine it self was alright, I had one of the pinot noirs (the flavors of the wine was lacking, i felt like it was flat... lol), my cousin ordered a bubbly, that was fine, and her friend ordered a Rose.

All it all, I'll admit that the atmosphere was nice, a little pretentious. lol and probably not a place i would go back to. =]
author: Judy W.

description:
Wine Jar has a very good selection of wine, as you would expect. I had a glass of Malbec and one of the Sauvignon Blancs.  Both were good, a better quality than most of the wine I've bought in stores, and a decent amount too.  They have a nice outdoor seating area, but the place inside is a bit small - this led to a rapid escalation of sound that forced us to yell after 5-10 minutes.  I hate being in places with bad acoustics, I shouldn't need ear plugs for a wine bar.  

I'll come back here at some point after I've tried a variety of others - the price wasn't a plus point but I did just miss the happy hour.
author: Ben K.

description: Ryan is great!  Very personable.  Chill atmosphere. .. no pressure... just relax and enjoy your favorite bottle.
author: Veggie G.

description:
I went here on a date, and he chose this place because we had talked about wines, but mainly because it was close to his apartment....

Anyway, the selection of wines is good.  The seating area is arranged in a manner where you can have a big group of people, or groups of twos sitting next to each other.  So you might end up sitting next to strangers if your party is small, but hey, it's nice meeting new people, right?

If you'd rather it just be you and your boo, you'll have to try to snag one of the more intimate areas in the darker corners of this place.

I'd probably come back again with my girlfriends for some cheese and wine.
author: Vira P.

description:
We thought our dinner plans had been washed down the drain - and then by some miracle we were able to snag a table at SPQR with a one hour wait (not bad).  

During our walk down Fillmore we had both noticed this cute wine bar and decided to trek back and enjoy some wine before dinner.  

The place has a nice interior with a good mix of bar and lounge seating.  Wine Jar has a comfortable and more intimate atmosphere that could be wonderful for some quiet date nights.  Wine selection was okay, if not a tad overpriced.  Now that I have some wine knowledge I find myself more judgmental on wine selection and wine pricing and I'm judging Wine Jar.  The wine was easy to drink and the pour was generous.  The bar snacks were the highlight with some spiced almonds, cashews from a can and something else I can't quite remember.  My experience here was tainted by the elusive bartender who also seemed to have the personality of a rock.  He made no attempt to crack a smile, provide recommendations, or have any conversation with us.  Forget trying to get the check, the BF had to go to the bar to cash out so we could make our dinner reservations.  From what I saw he was possibly the only one working the entire room, and for that this place loses another star for poor staffing.

I find that service will keep me coming back to places when it's good and keeps me away when it's bad and Wine Jar your service is bad.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I came here last night in hopes to have a drink while my boyfriend and I waited for our reservation down the street. The bar itself is super cute and I was excited to try somewhere new. We sat at the bar, which ended up being a poor decision because our conversation and mood was instantly taken over by the bartenders' conversation.
  They literally were venting about how their girlfriend won't let them help pick a fabric for the nook in their house... Wtf? Is it really so important that you ignore customers and talk crap about your girlfriend loud enough to ruin our night.
    I thought it was pretty unprofessional to discuss these things at work, at the front of the bar where customers are right next to you.. Calling your girlfriend a bitch and dropping F bombs isn't my idea of professional at work conversation. 
   Needless to say this place instantly killed our mood we had one drink, paid (with no tip) and got outta there.

Hopefully management sees that they need some fresh bartenders with better attitudes quick!
author: Natalie C.

description:
I used to live in the neighborhood and am extremely disappointed that I didn't discover this place when I did.  I'm not sure what the earlier reviewer is talking about because I was in last night as well and my experience could not have been more opposite.  We had barely sat down when we were greeted by Tyler and asked what type of wines we liked so that he could give us some recommendations if we wanted them.  My boyfriend and I both tasted a couple of wines before settling on our favorites for the evening (the Riesling and the Malbec).  We had a great time sitting at the bar and chatting with Tyler and the other patrons over (many) glasses of wine.  I will definitely be back!

Oh, added bonus- you can bring in outside food (and Delfina is only a couple of blocks away)!
author: Danica B.

description:
We just had our 2nd annual Christmas party here.  Jeff is so great to us and 12 girls can be loud.  Thanks for putting up with us and being such a great host!  See you next December if not before!
Thanks Jeff!
author: Jodi B.

description:
If you want your day to be spoiled by an incredibly rude bartender, go there. 

I was enjoying a sunny day and decided to have a glass of wine, when I stumbled upon this place. Since the moment I entered I was bossed by the bartender. I am pretty easy going so, I let it go, ordered my wine and sat outside to do some writing. When I wanted to pay  he said there was a $15 minimum for cards. I looked for cash but only had $7. My bill was $10 for a glass of wine. The standard charge for a card transaction is 2%. I offered him to pay 50 cents extra plus a generous tip. I just didn't want to pay $15. He told me that he was going to charge me $15. or I had to pay with cash. i tried to ask him nicely to help me out, but he told me to pay 15 NOW. i reminded him that by law the minimum was $10 - which was my bill and he was violating the law. He went on to forcefully take the card from my hand without even giving me a second to react. i said, "don't charge $15" he told said 'GET OUT' read rude tone. A girl standing by got so freaked out by his rudeness that she looked at me empathizing and left. I needed my card so I waited. Then he gave me the card and receipt and shouted. DON'T LOOK AT ME LIKE THAT, LEAVE AND NEVER COME BACK. Regardless of the card minimum, is it worth it being this rude and loosing 2 costumers - and possibly more - for $5 bucks. I didn't even say anything back at him since it isn't worth it. Wow, i pass bad wine, bad food, but rude dudes that take off whatever issues they have with costumers is something that shouldn't happen. Now reading other reviews it seems like it's a theme. Management: is time to work not only on costumer service but on pure decency. That dude should not interact with anyone.
author: luisa c.

description:
Great little neighborhood wine bar. limited beers but I'll survive.

decent outdoor seating but not much sun so rarely usable (worked for Fillmore Jazz Festival though!)

loud music and the offering of ear plugs is pretty classy. :-)
author: Mike V.

description:
What a shame. A good location, and initially quite promising vibe and calm / not too busy on a Friday night. My 3 friends warned me the bartender was very unpleasant and i thought they were exaggerating. I understand bad service happens from time to time, but this guy was actively rude, uninterested and terse. My worst service experience in 8 years in the US. Plus the chairs / booths are uncomfortable. 
Won't be returning until it's under new management.
author: Stephen J.

description: Great ambiance! The wine list includes a good variety. We had a great Malbec. We celebrated a birthday party amongst friends... Wasn't too loud, we had our own area and table... Overall great wine bar experience! We will be back!
author: Lauren C.

description:
I've definitely had better and I've definitely had worse. Wine Jar is just OK.

Have been here a handful of times and the service is usually a lot better than what my gal pals and I received a few Saturdays ago. I think it helps when you sit at the bar. Selection of wine isn't too shabby, but for a wine bar it lacks any "umph". And it doesn't help that the people serving it aren't too descriptive or excited about it, either.

Unenthused service aside, the worst part of my latest experience was taking the last drink of my glass of wine and getting a mouthful of sediment and cork. So gross that I spit it back out in the glass. Yes, it was just that nasty. I would have said something to our bartender/server but he didn't really seem to care much about us paying our tab, let alone dirty glass of vino.

There are plenty of other awesome wine bars worth exploring in SF and beyond, so unless you're in a bind, take your business elsewhere. You won't be missing much.
author: Abby S.

description: I love this no frills, cozy neighborhood wine shop. The Wine Jar has a simple but strong wine menu and the snacks one might want to nosh on with a glass or two. Great for small groups (10 or less) in the early evening, with some larger booths open most times M-F! Happy hour is 4PM-7PM M-F with 20% of all wine bottles and $3 beers. Located within walking distance of your favorite Fillmore restaurants/bars & just steps away from Kabuki theater & Japantown - the Wine Jar is a great little city spot.
author: Keristen B.

description: Cute decor date place. But super small and thought they would offer more with their wine pairings
author: Neli C.

description:
I think this place is great! I went with a dear childhood friend to have a glass of wine and catch up. Comfort seating, quiet, good serivce and the Sancerre white I got was AMAZING! (ended up having 4 glasses and I am not a big wine drinker). 
I love the ambiance in this little swanky wine bar.
author: Angie S.

description: Do not go here. We have had bad waiter experiences but this is the worst we experienced in the U.S. so far. Uninterested and arrogant.
author: Rozemarijn B.

description:
Horrible, horrible service and an incompetent bartender. 

I went with four friends after a movie for a glass of wine. We ordered a bottle (20% off  happy hour special until 7pm -- yay!). The place was empty aside from a couple in the corner, and we were quiet. After finishing the bottle, the bartender neglected to let us know that HH was ending soon... in case we wanted another bottle, which of course we did. Fine. 

So we missed the opportunity to get another and decided to go elsewhere. After getting the check, we noticed the bartender so conveniently added a 25% gratuity tip for herself (Automatic 25% tip for a $40 bottle of wine, really? So much for 20% off). And she certainly didn't deserve that much for doing.... well, not a whole lot. 

We put down five credit cards, which she didn't mention would be an issue. Four credit cards were returned to us. Excuse me, where's the fifth? It was sitting behind the counter, as she explained, because it was black (it was actually gray) and the counter was dark, so she didn't see it. She then explained that there is typically a $15 limit per credit card -- five cards would have made it $10 each, which wasn't acceptable. But she "let $12 a person slide... you're welcome." Interesting, for a rule we weren't aware of in the first place? And then you decided to keep my friends credit card? 

Glad to see I'm not the only one complaining about bad service here. I'd suggest finding somewhere else on Fillmore.
author: Estee M.

description: I love it here. Super chill.  Good. Trance/ loungey house vibes.  Right on Filmore but not so busy that you can't find a table. Dark corners for stealing kisses and a great knowledgeable staff.  Ask them to surprise you after you explain what you like in (or out) of a wine. The cheese plate with honey is great to curb a rising blood alcohol level.  Reasonable prices and generous prices...plus my favorite fact: always a seat.   Great date location.
author: Darby W.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and often come to wine jar for a quick and easy place to grab some wins and cheese. Generally you'll have to walk up to the bar to get service but it's never too crowded. 

As mentioned, there is wine and cheese but that's about it. You shouldn't come here expecting a full meal.
author: Kaego R.

description: This is a nice little bar but service was bad. The bartender spent the entire time at the other end of the bar talking to his friends about his upcoming honeymoon. And when I asked a question about a wine he seemed put out that he had to deal with me... I mean, congratulations on your wedding but I wanted to order cheese, I wanted to order another drink but instead I took the check. I wish I could've tipped him more, maybe a little something for his honeymoon, but oh well.
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
This place is not bad. I would not say I loved it because I think their wine is pretty overpriced for the quality. The ambiance is really nice and this is a great date spot if you want to spend a lot or your date does not know much about wine. 

It's close to my house so I might go back but mostly because we are lacking in wine bars in the area.

I'm sure their rent is really high which is why the prices are up there but the service was more than lacking which is why I would give them 3 stars.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
Love coming here for a wine and to kill some time with friends. Prices are good, wine selection is also good. It is quaint and intimate in here and I love this aspect of it. However, sometimes the bartender keeps the door open and it gets chilly. He also isn't the nicest person nor does he give the best customer service, which is a shame because this place could be really cozy and cool. 
It is average in that I wouldn't go out of your way to come here, but if you live nearby and want to catch up with a friend and don't care so mud about being waited on hand and food, this is good for exactly that.
author: E B.

description: This is a great cozy localszy kind of place. Love the happy hour. Really nice bartender dude. Barbera was tasty.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Apartment hunting blows... After seeing yet another place with 70's appliances, small cramped bathroom with no storage, and irreparably stained carpets listed for $4000 + your dignity, we decided there was nothing left to do but drink.

We found stools at the bar and were promptly greeted by a friendly bartender. The wine list has a lot of variety, but generally all in the $8-$14 range. They also have beer and some non-alcoholic drinks as well as snacks.

I ordered a glass of the Cabernet Franc which was very tasty. My friend ordered a glass of...I actually don't remember what she ordered, but she really liked it. It was easy to flag down the bartender to get the check. 

The atmosphere feels like a small neighborhood hangout and there are tables, couches, and stools to sit on depending on your seating preference. Only negative is how noisy it was.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Here right now for their happy hour, buy one bottle get a free cheese plate. So, where're my cheese plate? We've been
 here for a good 30 minutes and so far the bartender only approached us once and has been chit chatting away since before we got herewith some blonde with her dirty feet propped up on a bar stool. I was expecting at least for him to mention that by buying our bottle, we get a free cheese plate but I was thinking, well that's ok, I'll just mention it to him when he swings by our table again. But. He. Never. Came. Back. I just want to finish this bottle and leave... I wonder how long it'll take to get our check? Not coming here again. Wine was good though. Terrible experience.
author: Donna D.

description:
was there middle of the week and pretty much alone with only a few patrons at the bar, I had a couple of glasses of the Tempranillo/Syrah blend which was tasty for $8 a pop!
Place is super dark inside and its virtually impossible to see the bottle offerings...Also a giant TV in the middle of the room? in a wine bar?
Bartender was transparent and really showed a "I don't give a flying .... what you order and much less showing you the bottle so I can give you a little story behing the wine" attitude!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Nice guy to have around...as some "reviews" mentioned and I don't know what they are talking about,this place is NOT amazing! its ok but NOT amazing,sorry!
author: bob b.

description:
I love Wine Jar! It is right down the street from my house so its the perfect happy hour stop! The ambiance of this little place is great, perfect if you want to be able to hold a conversation with others.

Im docking a star because I would prefer them open until 1am or 2am

xoxo
author: Noelle L.

description: Great spot to hit up for Happy Hour before a movie at the Kabuki or dinner on Fillmore. Wine list is decent, and happy hour is 20% off all bottles which are decently priced.
author: Jane F.

description:
Glass of wines for 12 to 15. Wines weren't very good. Had the Sean minor and torii.

Decor is lightly lit and relaxed. Tv with sportscenter on.

And yes the other reviews are correct, Bartender was insanely rude.
author: Jones T.

description: Cute bar with great wine.  I had two glasses of their torrentes, because it was just that good.  I also tried the two types of wine my date had, which I can't recall the names of, but they were also pretty great.  I'm definitely coming back again.
author: Cici A.

description:
My first time hanging out in lower Fillmore, my friend and I stumble upon this place and OH. MY. GOODNESS. This place is amazing! I love how the setting of the bar is very intimate. Its a good place for couples who are looking for a nice place to just chill and have a quiet night. The lighting, the seeating its a good place to visit before/after dinner with a significant other. Its also good for group of friends since they have bigger table and a few couches.

We came in late Saturday night and it wasn't super pack. It was just perfect. They were also playing really fun music. The bartender was really nice and approached us as soon as we sat down. He also knows his wine, for when we asked him for suggestion, he gave us some pretty amazing choices. I had a glass of their Sauvignon Blanc and that time it was from New Zealand. It was really good and tasted like the wine you get when you go to wineries. My friend had a Malbec which was from Argentina and it was full of flavor! My friend and I were both happy with our glass, and take note, there were actually half-full!! 

Besides those two amazing wines that we have, they also offer other kinds of wine. They have a really extensive menu which also changes often. They have happy-hour and they serve light snack as well. 

If you're a wine love and you're exploring lower Fillmore, this place is a must must must go!! I myself will definitely come back!
author: Cathy B.

description: Laid back wine bar where you can make yourself at home. Love coming here to unwind with a glass or two whether solo or with friends. You can bring in outside eats, but I still wish they had more in house food offerings apart from a cheese plate with mixed nuts and bread.
author: Elaine W.

description:
Cool, hole in the wall-type, romantic ambiance & good wine selection.
Kind of pretentious & rude bartender.

$15 minimum on credit cards.
author: Briana F.

description:
Sigh. I went back again, even though I promised myself I wouldn't, and, ugh, an even worse experience than the first two times. 

Pray tell, what are TVs doing in a wine bar, unless you're trying to make the wine bar into a sports'n'wine bar? When my date and I arrived, the TVs were showing, of all things, The Karate Kid II, which was... amusing, but loud and distracting. 

But even more loud and distracting was the bartender, loudly telling his buddies (who dropped in from 1998 with backwards hats and sagging pants) that he got, and I quote, "sh*t-faced off Absinthe over Christmas" with his brother-in-law. 

Cool story, bro. Tell it again.
author: Allison S.

description: A great neighborhood spot! They recently added some new wines and the Pinot Noir I had was delicious! (It is the one from Sonoma but I am blanking on name.) I am excited to try the other new additions soon!
author: Kim M.

description:
(See pics)

Came here later at night but they do close at 1am. A small, intimate wine bar with a few side tables on the side, a line of bar area, as well some comfort sofas in the middle.

It's a good selection of wines but this is not about wine tasting, but more enjoying company with some decent priced bottles. We opened up a bottle of Prosecco for $42, just in time to celebrate a friend's new job!

Service was good and I do like the warm, at the same time chilling and relaxing, vibe that makes a good laid back weekend evening.
author: T L.

description: A new favorite local rendezvous spot for my hubby and I.  The decor is intimate and luring taking me back in into a time capsule and allowing me to enjoy this spectacular bottle of Rioja with my husband.  Enchanted by the exquisite conversations while enjoying the sexy and silky Spanish wine.  The cheese plate came with three different selections of cheese, assorted nuts and thin crackers which complimented our wine elegantly.  Its a fun place to people watch since most couples come here for their dates whether it be a first date or second date it's quite interesting to acknowledge that after a few glasses of wine they're all laughing and flirting courageously.  Come for the wine  and stay for the love affair.  There's a great happy hour as well.
author: Sharon N.

description:
One year ago, I am so excited about Wine Jar thinking finally, a place that serves affordable wine in casual settings in Pacific Heights. Being a wine enthusiast I have been waiting for a cheap wine place like that to take my friends to, so they can relax and enjoy my favorite liquid with me without stressing out. The dark romantic, and trendy decors, in a dimly lighted room, some small tables, lounge couches, and a bar with counter, the inside is much more glamorous than the poorly decorated outside: just the title and one string of xmas lights. 
The thing that has changed my view completely is that I have several bad experiences with the service:

1. my significant other and i stood in the door way for 10 minutes and watch the waitress go back and forth but never acknowledge our existence (this was the last straw, i haven't been back ever since). And we understood why an elderly couple just walked out before we arrived without ordering anything. 

2. Several times i observed the waitress is obviously too swamped by the full house to be in a good mood or serve us with smiles

3. Once/twice the menu was threw on the table when we were seated.

This is still a neighborhood spot, and often a full house on the popular weekend nights. And that says something about the price and the atmosphere for relaxing wine, pressure free. But at the same time that neighborhood lingering love made the bad service situation even worse. 

And yes, I am a neighbor only 4 blocks away, yet i would drive to north beach looking for parking for 30 minutes to find another wine place. Don't forget, price, setting aside, wine is in every way a service experience, good service is key to get people to enjoy wine and order more. The thing Ilove the most about wine is to enjoy it over conversations with good friends, not having my mood ruined by bad service, and worse yet, not being seated in the first place
author: Dilys S.

description:
Literally just had one of the worst customer service experiences. The bartender/manager Tyler (he said he was the manager,  when asked) chased us out of the bar when we decided not to patron the establishment due to Tyler's hostile attitude. He had no customer service skills and refused to answer questions about the wines. He slammed a wine bottle down and hastily asked "what do you want". When my partner and I decided we did not want to contribute to the establishment due to his aggressive demeanor, he decided to chase us outside. I filmed the entire ordeal because I was worried he was going to get physically violent. I'm writing this review because I am shocked at this horrible/un-nerving experience and hope the owners are aware of the type of employee they are currently employeeing. This type of attitude will surely drive away business. We will never be back and will be more than happy to warn others about our experience there. 

No one should be treated so poorly. Tyler "the manager" needs a lesson in customer service. Not even sure if that is his name. We stopped by at 9 pm on 8/22. Hoping management will do something about this employee.
author: Giovanni L.

description: Had the Torrontes, Rose, and the Cotes Du Rhone Blanc.  All were awesome.  The bartender was nice.  The layout was cool and allowed for ppl to have their own little spaces.  Was there late on a Wednesday night and the vibe was mellow, giggly, and horny.  As a wine lounge should be.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Wine in a plastic cup?! no. I don't care if your customers broke a few glasses last year during the Fillmore Jazz Festival, don't try serving me wine in a plastic cup, if I wanted wine in a plastic cup I'd pay half the price and go to the vendors outside on the street.
author: Kiran J.

description:
I don't know who this mystery monster of a server/owner is that everyone's yelping about, but we were served by 'Michael' who was the sweetest & most helpful person ever!

What we had:
1 glass Meadowcroft
1 glass Carma
1 glass Casaeda
1 bottle Pellegrino
-----
total: $41.25 (w/out tip)

I had the three glasses of wine & they were all different & delicious.

We came by on a Sunday evening after my shift and it started filling up after an hour or so, and to be honest I actually enjoyed the more upbeat fun music as opposed to sleepy jazz or something that I would've passed out to with above-mentioned 3 glasses of vino.

I like this place.  Good wine, good vibes, but I will try to avoid it over the weekend just in case it gets nuts.

Salud!
author: Anjali V.

description:
Was coming back from dinner looking for the next bar to check out.  My Yelp radar beamed me intel on the wine jar as the next place I should swing by and check out.  

Cool place.  Dark interior, trendy couches, an actual bar to sit at.  Got a table by the window (all the trendy couches were inhabited)  and checked out the menu.  The place wasn't too loud but depending on the size of the group and how noisy they are could change that.  

They have beer available but you don't go to a wine bar to pound a beer.  

Went up to the bar figuring we had to order there but the bartender said he would swing by our table.   

Wine selection is pretty limited - which surprised us given that's what they do but we made a selection - 12 bucks a glass for what we picked.  There were some cheaper some more expensive.  I didn't recognize the wine that I ordered and didn't bother to start a frenzy-ed goggling everything on the menu so I just went for it.

Got the drinks in a few minutes, enjoyed our drinks looking out the window watching people walk by.  

Overall a good experience.
author: R P.

description:
Both time I've been to Wine Jar have been completely enjoyable.  We grabbed drinks here while waiting for a table to open up at nearby Woodhouse Fish Co. The atmosphere is cool and very wine bar-esque.  I haven't had to deal with any crowd/noise issue, and I love that they have couches and different types of seating available. Decent wine selection, reasonable prices and friendly staff...recipe for success in my book!

Would happily return to round out the hat trick!
author: Brianna M.

description:
OMG, how did I ever miss this cozy little gem?

We strolled by in search of an after-Dosa drink, and whaddya know, Wine Jar was waiting.  Luckily for us, last Saturday was their two year anniversary, furnished with a full table of munchies and lots of balloons (wine+balloons = toasty fun).

Ambiance is kind of dark, kind of intimate.  Choose between a personal bar experience, laid-back couches in the middle of the room, or a semi-privado booth.  Oh the choices in life.  If you can snag one of the booths, then by all means, do it!  Booths still offer full service, which I'm sure comes in really handy when you're on a date and want a little...um...privacy.

I'm really not a wine snob, but I've become a Malbec fan over the years.  With that said, I was very happy with the menu selection.  ****Half-glass options make choices so much easier****

Great wine, food, service.  Definitely making my way back!
author: Angella S.

description: NEVER BRING DATE HERE!. Something wrong with the bartender. He was being rude and stupid, constantly interfering and not letting us have a conversation. We decided to leave the place after a glass of wine, and go somewhere else. This place could have been a neighborhood gem, now I understand why not many people in the neighborhood would go here. This place is empty most of the time.
author: Mike S.

description: What a great spot that holds on to its true spirit and local vibe in spite of changes up and down Fillmore.  Jeff knows his stuff and if you need guidance, his knowledge is always spot on.  The interior is welcoming, warm and special as are the folks that you'll meet here.
author: Tracy H.

description: Decent wine. Allowed me to try like 5 before I settled on a Russian River Pinot. Generous cheese plate.  Good happy hour deals. Super cozy inside and outdoor seating.
author: Christina S.

description:
My friend and I came here for a glass of wine after dinner when we couldn't get into Fat Angel (one of our favorites).  I'd always wanted to try this place and Fillmore is sorely lacking in drinking establishments, so we hiked up here.

Unfortunately, this wasn't the wine bar experience I expected or wanted.  The bartender acted like he was doing us a favor by bringing us a menu and taking our order, which made me uncomfortable from the start.  The music was so loud it was like being in a nightclub, which was weird.  There was also a TV (no sound), but it gave it a sports bar vibe.

Nothing we ordered was special.  The cheese plate was forgettable.  I didn't care for my wine and passed on a second glass, but my friend tried a different type and they brought it in the same glass she used for her first glass.  What?  

It was a mob scene in there, so obviously some people really dig it.  It just wasn't my scene and there are too many places that I can go where the bartenders aren't rude to me for no reason.
author: Kimberly B.

description: We were told this place was sold to new owners @ 3 months ago or so.  My husband and I were enjoying a glass of wine and the cool bartender 'JT' told us about the sale and pointed to the new owners who happen to be there for the evening.  As regulars we were bummed that our favorite watering hole was changing hands but were hopeful that the new owners would be cool.  NO such luck. While there we waived to them as to say 'Welcome and looking forward to seeing you in the future'. They looked at us like we were crazy. No smile, no waive back, actually they looked a bit angry.  Weird way to meet your new regular patrons.  Anyway, a few weeks later decided to stop in for a nite cap which we do periodically before walking home from dinner, it was 9:40pm and as we walked in the very rude bartender yelled 'we're closed'.  We asked what are the new hours and she barked 10pm. Huh, ok so we have like 20 minutes, right!?  Wrong, she refused to serve and was rustling around picking up everyone's drinks if they were finished or not.  The whole vibe of this place has changed. It went from delightful to dismal.  Sad to say I don't think we will be going back.  It's such a convenient little wine bar with so much promise and nice selection of wine but who needs the attitude!?
author: Lisa T.

description:
Color me unimpressed + underwhelmed, Wine Jar.

I mean, I'm pretty dang lenient when it comes to most 'things' service-industry related. (Hell, probably too much so!) People get busy, places get busy, and stuff happens. Life happens, and everything simply can't be perfect always. But Wine Jar... you're, well, you're not doing it right. You're doing it wrong, in fact.

In a nutshell: super apathetic service... both the bartender and our server seemed put out by the fact that we wanted to order drinks. Also, getting water? That was an ordeal as well. (Pretty sure I got an actual eye-roll from our server when I went to inquire as to if it would be possible to get some water -- not that he was paying attention or offered or anything... )

This happened, too:
-my dear friend Jen to our server: "Hi! This beer looks interesting. Can you tell me a little more about it?"
-server to Jen: "Well, it's not like an ale, and it's not like a stout... "
-Jen: "Do you like it?"
-server: "No."

The kicker to all of it? I had to take our bill up to the bar to be settled, and poor Annie D was overcharged. I just... I don't know. I mean, I understand that places get busy and people get overwhelmed, but if you're in the service-industry and representing an establishment, maybe don't act like you're doing everyone a favor by rudely doling out the drinks that they are, in fact, paying for. (It wasn't even that busy, really!)

Not so much, Wine Jar.
author: Rachel F.

description:
I shan't mince words: Wine Jar was awfully mediocre and the only reason I visited was because the wait at Fat Angel was too long. In fact, I'm sure this is where most of Wine Jar's business comes from, judging from the reviews. 

Aloof, inattentive service.

Terrible music (Crazy Frog, Pitbull and Katy Perry all made appearances).

Wine is overpriced, but then again it is at most bars - the next day I purchased a full bottle of Torii Mor Pinot Gris for the same price that Wine Jar charges for a glass.

My drinking companion found half a cork floating in her glass of wine, but we didn't dare further disturb or inconvenience our waiter's work shift with the news - getting his attention was like trying to clingfilm an earthworm, and the place wasn't exactly busy.
 
There's not much more you need to know.
author: Kat F.

description:
Friend and I were about to head home but we realized that it was only 8:30 pm! We felt lame so I asked her if she wanted to try Elite Cafe's chocolate martini? She was down. 

We parked at her work, walking distance to Fillmore. By the time we got to Elite, it was packed! Then we ventured off to Harry's Bar - packed again. Then she suggested going to this place b/c she's been before. Me: "OK"

We walked in, it wasn't packed! Of course we stayed. We managed to get a table right by the door and we got stationary there for the whole night. 

Friend is a fan of Cabernet and me, Pinot. We each got two half glasses of each. The server said gave us our wines really fast, so the whole night, we had no idea what wine was from what vineyard! 

The plus: their half-glasses were good portions! The minus: both of us each had a glass that was really nasty, but again, we had no idea what vineyard it was from! We decided to finish off the bad one first then go to the good one. 

By the time it was the good wine, my taste buds were messed up from the nasty Pinot. BUT of course, I drank it! 

Total for the 4 half-glasses = $30+ NOT freaking bad! I told her to just tell me when she wants to have drinks, I'm there! It's close to my sis's and her house plus she has parking from work, what more can we ask for? 

OH the ambiance + decor was very plush, if that's even a word! Modern, there. =)

We'll be back =) Hopefully for Tuesday since they have that $15 for 3 tasting!
author: Cath M.

description:
Checked out the Wine Jar just the other night with some friends after stuffing our faces over at BeniHana.  

Chill, relaxed place with outdoor patio seating, which immediately caught my eye, as I love to sit outside when it's nice out.

Funky interior with a carved bar, which makes it nice for small groups of people to sit at the bar, but still all be able to see and hear each other.

Shared two bottles of wine with my husband and friend..... I believe it was one of the Cabs, I honestly don't remember which one but it was reasonably priced which is why we ended up getting two.

The bartender was really nice, and super helpful.  Checking in on us, but never in the way.

I'd definitely recommend this place for a drinks date, it's got a nice low key, but romantic vibe.  I will most definitely be back, maybe for my own bottle of wine.
author: Margaret I.

description: Kinda spensies, kinda nice, kinda super slow service. Sectioned areas like a club for bottle service. Big TVs showing cheesy movies. Won't be back. I'm not saying I hate it, but this place could be featured in one of the hostel movies ;)
author: James S.

description: I arrived here with a date at about 11pm on a Friday. It was busy but luckily for us a small group of people were just leaving as we got there, so we snagged their table. It was near the back and very private, which was really nice. Service was good but not obtrusive, and we had an easy time just chatting with little to no distractions. Overall a nice experience and I will be going back. I hadn't been there in a long time and I had forgotten how much I liked it.
author: Lori M.

description:
The Wine Jar is a great, quite spot on Fillmore street. The time I went there was a gentleman playing the celllo -- a great touch. Our server was really funny, as one of my friends was being stubborn about what wine he wanted, she jokingly played along (I always appreciate a server who can dish it back out).

After the cello player stopped, a great array of music played over the speakers. Phenomenal lounge music, mixed with a lot of the bands I hear when I seed Pandora with the "Air" station. I'm a huge music junky, and truly believe it can set any mood, this is a huge deal for me.

There are small individual tables that you can curtain off, little nooks if you will. What a terrific spot to go with another couple or take a date. I'll end with this, great pinot selection.
author: Jason M.

description:
After going to Fat Angel and seeing a crowd outside huddled over a table, shivering with their wine glasses in tow, I bravely walked into Fat Angel and requested a table for two. I looked around and it was packed. All I wanted was a glass of wine. And some cheese. The bartender looked and me and nicely informed me that there'd be a 20 minute wait. 

I managed a smile, which was both forced and sad. I Yelp'ed nearby places and was fill with optimism when I saw that Wine Jar was only a few blocks away.

It was a cute place and possibly the nicest, most elegant wine bar I've seen yet. Whoever did the interior did a fantastic job. It is sexy, dark yet you can manage to see your date, and it was lush. There were some private seating areas that could be blocked off with the somewhat velvet-y curtains. 

We chose the couch in the middle and sat down. 

A nice gentleman with a vest asked us if we were ready. We said yes and proceeded to order some glasses. 

Things went downhill after we got our glasses. I noticed that there were a few tables open and one of the private seating areas was open, but a group of 4 came in and stood there -- obviously it was their first time - not knowing if they should sit down or wait to be seated. They stood and lingered near the doorway for about 4 minutes. Given the fact that the place is so intimate and there were two servers that night, making your patrons linger around is really not the way to go in the food industry.

After looking at the menu, i decided I wanted to try their cheese ($11 for one selection, $16 for 2). I went to the bar after looking around for about 5 minutes - no one had bothered to check up on us - and encountered a guy with blonde hair who just stood there - behind the bar -  staring.  In the process of wondering if he was working or just another patron, we just had a staring contest. He never asked, 'Hey, can i help you?' or 'What would you like?'  I made a safe bet that because he was behind the bar - he was likely working there.  i asked if i could order some cheese and he just nodded. 

I told him what I wanted and I'm not sure if he didn't want to work that night or if he was just having an 'off' night - but I regretted ordering anything. When he came to give us our cheese, he practically threw it down on the table. I'm sorry, did we offend you? Usually, the servers will tell you which cheese is which...but here, the servers are way beyond that. The attitude and lack of any sort of hospitality that is custom in the restaurant industry is just laughable here. 

While both cheeses we ordered were good, the wafers/psuedo crackers it came with were bland..with no sort of texture or anything. i felt like I was eating solidified air if there was such a thing.  How about some bread? The plate was filled with nuts and olives..both of which I don't like on my cheese plate. 

If anything - he is an expert credit card swiper. I've never given anyone my credit card and within seconds, had everything handed back to me to sign.
author: Vanessa W.

description: Live tango music every other sunday and a great choice of wines
author: Priyanka P.

description: Always a pleasure! Love the atmosphere. Great happy hour specials and friendly staff.
author: Darrell R.

description:
I'm mystified that it has taken me almost three years to make it into this place!   I live around the corner from Wine Jar and decided to pop in for a night cap after dinner on Fillmore with my cousin.  From the moment we walked in, the bartender (Jeffrey) was extremely friendly and happily answered any questions we had about the wine list.   We only planned on staying for one drink but the conversation, music and overall atmosphere hooked us and we ended up staying until close!
 
I'll definitely be coming back to Wine Jar soon!
author: Liz K.

description:
Glass half-full wine bar...Literally, my glass is never empty. 

My husband and I have been coming here for three years now.  While it is conveniently located in our neighborhood, we would come here regardless for the wine, cozy yet chic ambiance and great service. 

They have a pretty good selection of red and white wines as well as sparkling wine. We are big fans of the Russian River Pinot Noir and any of the three sparkling wines they currently offer. With an almost "Cheers" type of feel, Jeff (the bartender) always has a glass of the Pinot poured for us when we walk in. Of course, when they add a new red or we are in the mood for something else, he's quick to offer recommendations including some tastings. 

Friday nights can be busy with pre-show drinkers given its close proximity to Kabuki - but, do not fear - while you may have to wait for a chair, you won't wait long for a drink.  Wednesday and Thursdays are a little more relaxed, making this a great place for happy hour. Their cheese plates are delicious (including four different types of cheeses, olives, and crackers) and they also allow you to bring food in from a few nearby restaurants (e.g., Out the Door). This is great when happy hour extends into dinnertime! 

While we have never reserved the entire bar for the night, we have hosted a few large-group events. Jeff makes sure to reserve an area appropriate for our sized group and is very attentive to our guests. As one reviewer mentioned, Jeff has the perfect balance of checking in - making sure you have a drink and anything else you may need - but not hovering.  Come bill time, Jeff is so organized that he helps minimize those awkward conversations at the end of the night around who owes what. 

Aside from Jeff, we have found the other bartenders/servers to be just as personable. - making the Wine Jar a place you feel welcome and want to return to.
author: Shelley O.

description: Love this spot, the bartender is a really nice guy. I have brought several dates here and he is always kind and respectful. The ambiance is great a good balance of guys and girls.
author: Joseph H.

description:
Thought it was a cute little place.  A friend and I came across it while wasting time before catching a movie over at kabuki theatre.

Nothing was unusual about the place (your typical wine bar) and it was quite cozy :) The seats seem to fill up but we just joined another table which seems to be the idea to mix and mingle. 

Cute enough for me to want to go back again if I have another chance to waste time before a movie :)

ps I think some of the photos on the yelp page are a little outdated, it seems they've updated the seating and some of the decor
author: Sunny D.

description:
LOVED this place.  Our server was incredibly helpful and suggested a great wine for us to try (i was set on a Cali cab, but my friend wanted something lighter, so we had to compromise). 

They had a great HH on Sunday and our bottle ended up being 20% off.

Noticed on the menu they allow you to order from a few local restaurants and still sit and enjoy yourself in their venue.

Definitely will go back when I'm in town again!
author: Sarah M.

description: This place is okay. The service is bad. The cheese plate was not great and really expensive ($16) for what seemed like a few cheap slices of cheese. Nothing horrible, but I wouldn't go back.
author: Ann P.

description: I like the ambiance of this wine bar. Very cozy and comfortable neighborhood wine bar with a large selection of wine from US and Europe. It is apparent I like the place as I've here several times.
author: Nessa M.

description:
Date place *coughs* Date place

[The decor here is dark, modern and classy. They had a great selection of wine in a half glass, glass and bottles]

If you're waiting for a movie at Kabuki to start or need something do after a movie, this is the place to come.
author: Carlos A.

description: This place is all about the bartender.  Mine was grumpy, in old yoga pants, and disinterested.  It's like someone's melancholy little sister was forced to serve wine here.  She had better things to do than get us wine and a cheese board.  The wine was good - I recognized the vintage so I knew what to get.
author: Sarah N.

description:
This is actually one of the wine bars where I didn't feel any excitement really from the bartender. Usually, when asked their opinion on some of the wines, the bartender's eyes light up and they're more than happy to give me their opinion. However, the bartender that night at this establishment didn't have much to say. Though he was very nice and provided good service. Interestingly enough, when asked his opinion on the cheeses, he seemed to show more excitement about that.

Anyway, this place is very relaxed and somewhat quiet. This is a great place for great conversation because they set this place up so that groups of people can sit around the table on the couches or one of their many booths.
author: Rylan C.

description: Wine Jar is a cute&cozy wine bar which you love to bring a date. Its not a fancy place but i really love the ambiance :) You should definitely try their Zinfandel..
author: Erdem O.

description:
Wine Jar is great if you get there for Happy Hour and you are able to find a seat.  Those two items I think are essential to enjoying your experience at this place.  Oh, it also helps to have great company as well but that is true for wherever you happen to be.

The Happy Hour discounts are awesome and if you need something to nosh on then I suggest the cheese plate.  Generous on the accouterments for sure and the cheese is just oh so D-lish with the wine.

The service has always been helpful and friendly whenever I have been here and I love how they seem to know when you might be needing more wine or perhaps that bottle you are savoring is suiting you just fine.
author: Kylie L.

description:
This is one of my favorite little places on Fillmore to grab a glass of wine with my friends. It's really quaint and certainly has limited seating options but has a nice neighborhood feel to it.

I've never had any issues with the bartender here. He's always been really friendly.
author: Leanne S.

description:
It's the location and mixture of seating (outside, bar, couches and tables) is what has me coming back, not the selection of wine or the service.

i've been here a few times, and the service is pretty blah. The owner is okay, but he always seems to have rude "friends" or "regulars" there talking to him that just ruin the ambiance. If this was my bar, I might not care, but it's a wine bar. Wine bars are usually a bit more tamed, and I feel like the bartender/owner just never provides that wine recommendation you want. Yes, I am aware that you stock only the best wine, but when I ask for a simple opinion, you can give it!

One plus about this place is you can order outside food! Just noticed the other day they list neighborhood restaurants (Out the Door, Delfina, Extreme Pizza, etc...) that will deliver to your spot.
author: Laura H.

description:
I have been here a couple of times before and today I was in the neighborhood so I figured I'd write a review since I've recently come in. 

There isn't anything so exciting or repelling of about this place. It's clean, cozy and quaint. The location and mixture of seating (bar, couches and tables, along side a few little nooks) is comfy which for the most part have given me reason to come back every so often. The space is cozy but big enough for your small group or a guest to relax in your own space and the music is kept at an reasonable volume, just loud enough where everyone else surrounding you wont be hearing your conversation. 
The decor is warm, and on the dim side but not so dark that you can't see who you're talking to.
Although I'm not that much of a wine drinker from what I hear the selection of wine was so-so.  The service was alright but nothing really worth sharing/commenting about.  

The down side of this place is they don't have a large menu of things to nibble on but they do allow and encourage people to order take out/delivery from the neighboring businesses which is a good idea since it doesn't seem like they plan on broadening their food selection.
author: Karen G.

description: Hey, Wine Jar, look alive! Its a neighborhood gem: great wine, amazing atmosphere, good pricing....awful service. For a neighborhood (and unpretentious) wine bar the people that work there are always extremely rude. A little less attitude....a lot more smiles, please! All customer service issues aside, it's a great wine bar and perfect date spot.
author: Robin J.

description:
It is a small and cozy place like many others said, and I have been wanting to check it out since I saw it last Oct. I finally got a chance to do so when my girlfriend was in town yesterday. I was so disappointed. 

1st, the bartender was rude and unfriendly. He had no smile and shown no patient to us. It took him at least 10 min to come to us because he was seemingly having a pleasant conversation with another customer. Then, when we about to ask him for any recommendation, he walked away to go back to that to-be-continued conversation. We finally figured out what to order after reading pages of the printing paper (their wine menu), and asked him to came over again. He was so impatient that I felt I was not welcomed.

He may be loved by many others, but he is one of the few rudest bartender I have ever experienced. 

2nd, watch out for your credit card if you are planning to use it. Our bill was about $32. My girlfriend paid with her credit card. Then, I got a call this morning from her that she was charge again for $87. She had to make a trip back to the city today to straight things out with them. I feel really bad now because I was the one who choose the place. 

I will not go back there again for sure.
author: Lydia L.

description:
Makes for a good after a movie at the Kabuki stop. 

Only 4 customers were at the Wine Jar on a recent Thursday night visit when we first arrived, but after seating ourselves and waiting for several minutes we still had to get up and grab our own menus. 

The wine was fine and we were able to find a reasonably priced bottle, the cheese plate (your only food option) isn't going to be winning any awards for presentation  (one cheese must have been at the end of the wheel as we got hacked up little pieces), I wouldn't go out of my way to visit again but it's ok.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: Wine and ambiance were fine, but the bartender (only worker in the place - owner??) left me wondering.  He seemed almost upset when we (and other people) asked to sample a wine before buying a glass, and he had a very aggressive wine delivery style of practically throwing glasses at people.  It was a Sunday afternoon and we were practically the only people in the place, but he spent most of his time either in the back room or in the far corner of the place.  One and done...
author: J D.

description:
Great wine menu, great out-of-the-ordinary bottled beer selection. Those get a star each.

Subpar service took away the other 3 stars & took away from our experience. In the service industry, shouldn't one be hospitable? There was an air of "ugh" from the Bartender. Maybe because he was flying solo on the shift - it's a small place - and the place got busy that night. I see that as an opportunity. The Bartender seemed to see it as a burden - catering to more than the usual number of patrons who are demanding things! Not the right industry for this particular individual. Sorry for inconveniencing you. Thanks for making it apparent.

I still left 20% tip since I'm never going back or recommending the place (maybe if I see a different person working when I wander by) and can really leave a low rating without a second thought.
author: M. E.

description: There's one word to describe this place: dark. A very chill place to hang out with a group in an intimate setting. A nice thing about this place is that they let you bring in outside food, which we did with pizza from pizzeria delfina a few blocks away. Other than that there wasn't really anything particularly outstanding about it. It's more like a place to sit around and then be on your way.
author: Becky L.

description:
I'm not a fan.  I bought one of those living social coupons for the place and even though it was 2 days expired, the guy flatly turned me down on using it.  Well, there goes $20 watsed without so much as a blink of an eye from the bartender.  

Having worked in the food/beverage business for many years, I would have known well enough to either:
a) sucked it up and let me use the coupon
b) been a cool guy about it and at least offered a glass of wine on the house (or even a larger pour?  christ!)
c)  at least pretended to be apologetic that i wasted the money on nothing.

And it's not just the coupon... service isn't friendly there in general and we waited 15 minutes to be noticed because dude man was to busy chatting up some girl.

I don't think so, buddy!
author: Sara W.

description:
I had been here once before and failed to write a review... we had partied all night long and ended the night here so I thought it better to save my review for a proper visit. 
We came on a Saturday night and snagged two seats at the bar. I believe our server was Zoe but I'm entirely sure of her name. She offered some great suggestions and actually stayed to chat with us for quite a while. My husband had plenty to drink and was quite chatty himself so it worked out. 
Since we live so close its nice to have a wine bar that is friendly and welcoming- and just fun! The other patrons seemed to be enjoying themselves and that is always a plus! 
We will certainly be back- I noticed they also have Chimay which is one of my favorites!
author: Janell D.

description:
Tried to like this place, despite the first experience.  It had just opened up a little while ago when we first went.  The hipper-than-thou young lady behind the bar had to be asked several times before she looked up from her book and even acknowledged our existence.  Then the bar had no lime or lemons for our designated driver's sparkling water.  Odd for a bar, even a beer & wine place only, but whatever...not a biggie.  All in all, the general impression of the group was that the service & space do not warrant the prices.  

Fast forward a few months, and livingsocial prompted us to give the place another go (well, nobody was going to pay full price to give it another go, but it WAS in the neighborhood, and it'd be so nice & convenient if the last time was just an off day).  Purchased the voucher.  And let it expire.  As per state law, the paid portion of the voucher is apparently valid for 5 years, and I've had other merchants honor it for that amount.  But not these guys.  They just outright said that they had stopped accepting them, and I should deal with livingsocial from here on.  He wasn't rude about it, but the message was loud & clear that they were not going to honor what was apparently the law here.  I called livingsocial, they agreed that it was the law & it should've been honored, and issued a refund.  

There are entirely too many nice places in SF to ever go here again.  It's always a pity, though, when a bar within walking distance doesn't work out.
author: Godot -.

description:
My rating oscillates between 3 and 4 stars.

I've been here half a dozen times on different days and at different times. The wine selection is always excellent. It's a great place to go before or after dinner or a movie. The only drawbacks are the ridiculous crowds on Thurs-Sun nights. That and even when it's not at all busy the bartender is sometimes spacey requiring you to walk up to the bar to place an order in a mostly empty, tiny wine bar.

However, he's super nice, once you get his attention and is great at answering questions without an air of snobbery. He makes even my friends who claim to know nothing about wine, feel comfortable here. 

I love the dim lighting and swanky but comfortable couches and chairs. Great for a quiet, romantic conversation on any non-weekend evening.
author: Dani D.

description: Had a great time here on friday night.  The place is very dark though.  When we first parked we thought it was closed since nothing was lit.  I had the malbec and the carma, which weren't bad.  (personally I think I favor the malbec).  However I prefer the wine selection at noeteca.   My friend had the pinot noir, carma, and zin.  I really felt like the zin and the carma tasted very similar to each other.  I didn't try any of their cheese plates since we already had a nice dinner, but maybe some other time.  (although their selection seems limited compared to noeteca in noe valley).
author: Tiffany C.

description:
We wandered into here randomly while walking through the Pacific Heights neighborhood on a Friday night. It seemed pretty chill, not a ton of people, so we decided to check it out. I liked the ambiance and the fact that it seemed like a good local spot. It wasn't crowded or super loud, I was able to hear the music playing and hold a conversation without shouting. 

They had a decent wine selection by the glass (we should have just gotten a bottle) and the prices were moderate. I wouldn't say this was a special place I'd recommend, just an okay spot to wander into. The bartenders weren't very tentative and just hung back and talked amongst themselves mostly. I'd say stop by to grab a glass of wine...and that's it.
author: Marilyn V.

description:
i loved this place last night. My husband and I enjoyed a glass of wine and a Moretti, and entertained ourselves with some of the coffee table books and trivia cards at the bar.  the place was super chill, with an unpretentious vibe, so we'll definitely be back.  overall, i'd say its a solid wine bar that sets itself apart from the rest by not coming accross as too snooty.

However, the icing on the cake leading to my 5 star review.... i walked out without my purse (i guess the drinks hit me a little hard), and the bartender ran out onto filmore to give it to me.  so i'll be back... and tipping well :)
author: Kelly L.

description:
Wine Jar is a fantastic place to wrap-up a great date or catch up with a friend over a few glasses of vino.  

The space is cozy but large enough for you and your date to carve out your own space without other couples hearing your entire conversation and catching whiffs of your wine.  It looks more swanky than rustic but the music they play keeps it real and the lighting is flattering but not intimidatingly dark.
author: Krystle S.

description: Great wine. Great vibe. Little on the pricey side, but if you're a wine connoisseur like myself, you will definitely appreciate the variety and expert service. Definitely try the cheese plate, perfect for a happy hour.
author: Tori M.

description: Nice casual place to meet friends with a great wine selection
author: Dilly M.

description:
I am giving this place 3 stars simply because I wasn't able to really get a feel for the place. 
I think it is a nice, small new wine bar which makes me happy to not have to hike over and down the hill to the Marina to grab a nice glass of vino.

The decor is very cigar bar..why I describe it as such? I don't know but it was a sort of lounge, meet neutrals sort of vibe.

It is small so keep that in mind if you are thinking of inviting your sorority girls out because it will be VERY cozy.

However, their selection is decent but their prices are a little more than   I would like to pay for a Reisling that sort of deal.
But, their pours are generous and they give the option to do a half pour if you would rather mix and match from their offerings and not want to get stuck sipping on one varietal.

I will go back for sure, as it is close, and Fillmore definitely needed some fresh blood on the block.
author: Kathy K.

description:
If you're single: A great place for the end of a first date after a movie at the Kabuki or dinner on Fillmore. Small and pretty dark, this place is nice for one last glass (or bottle, if it's going THAT well) before you depart ways. The wine selection is pretty impressive too, and the bartender (or wine guy?) is very well-versed in the various selections. 
If you're in a relationship: Again, a great place for an after-dinner/movie drink. Also good for an after work glass of wine with your sweetheart, especially on nice days when you can sit outside and people watch. 
Either way: Decently priced glasses/bottles of wine. Great selection. Chill ambiance and comfy decor. Might not be for everyone, if you can't handle the relaxed vibe, but give it a try and see for yourself!
author: Sarah M.

description:
If you happen to be a Straight Man reading this review, bookmark this place immediately! 

Why, you ask? 

Beautiful women, hip music, delish wine, more beautiful women.. and no single men.

Odds are in your favor. Just do it!
author: Chrissy L.

description: The wine bar is a good spot for a date, dim lighting, low music, and a good selection of wine and champage by the glass. The wines by the bottle are a little pricy, but they are good quality wines. The bartender was friendly and kept my wine and water glass full.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
The Wine Jar is a nice place for an after dinner drink.  They could definitely use some sprucing up on the wine menu, I literally mean the menu itself (it was a pile of papers that were stapled together).  The wines on the list were decent and I found one I enjoyed.

Overall pleasant experience.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Before heading out to dinner one night we stopped by Wine Jar which had been a bookmark on Yelp for me for a while.  This isn't in our neighborhood so we haven't had a chance to check it out and I forgot where I read about it.  It was pretty busy inside but we were able to (barely) squeeze into a tight spot at the bar.  My wife and I each ordered a glass of wine and then we had the olives and mixed nuts.  The atmosphere was pretty cool and if we come back I'd rather sit in a different seat as we didn't get the full view of the place.  There was a good selection of wines and at reasonable prices.
author: Blake B.

description:
Fun crowded little place. We came in as a party of five and we immediatey crowded at the bar. It was the only seating available. luckily for us the ladies at the bar noticed a table of two ladies and ask us if we'd mind switching. It went over so personably I couldn't believe it.
