Perfect little wine bar - much needed on Fillmore street! The wine list isn't overwhelming, but the selection is still great with wines from several different regions. I had a fabulous Malbec from Argentina, and we indulged in a very reasonably priced cheese plate!

Great wines, comfortable ambiance and friendly staff - will definitely be back!
author: Ellie C.

description:
Elegant and comfortable neighborhood wine bar.  Very chill.

Best value on wine: get a group of 4 and share a bottle, or order the tastes as the by-the-glass selection is limited.

Simple cheese plates.

This place encourages you to stop by but not overstay.  Just right for a weekday night post work.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Small and Charming. They have a nice crowd, good selection of wines, and are right near the Kabuki theatre for a night cap. 

The space is dark, with maybe twenty seats, including the bar and some chairs and tables throughout the space.

I think this is a really nice addition to Fillmore street, as that street used to die at 9:00. Now, you can stop in around 11:00, have a drink or two, and catch a cab home. 

I highly suggest this place. It impressed me more that I thought possible.
author: Christopher W.

description: Nice selection of imported beers for the happy hour. I was able to try 3 beers that I've never had. The seating area is cozy and would be good for small gatherings.
author: Lou T.

description: Very pleasant, neighborhood feeling place.  You can bring outside food in (I think a Slanted Door owned restaurant is nearby).  Decent wine selection.
author: brewgirl b.

description: Meh. I hate the cooler than thou decor combined with the sports on the big screens.  (I have to say, the last term I'd use to describe this place is "cozy.") The seating configurations are nice though.  Service seemed a little spotty - at times too attentive, at others, not enough.  The selections of wine was nice, nothing too exotic, but nice.  I do love the fact that you can get food from lots of the nearby restaurants to enjoy at the jar.
author: She-Ra ..

description: Awesome little wine bar. Great place to grab a drink or two before heading out for the night. Tuesday nights are tasting nights which reveal a bit of a quieter side of this place.
author: Chris B.

description: I'm going to give Wine Jar 4 JARS instead of 4 STARS. Get it?  It rhymes but they're two totally different words.  This is a fantastic wine bar to grab a glass before or after a movie at Kabuki or before or after dinner at SPQR or before or after a conert at the Fillmore.  The low lighting makes everyone sexy, so beware upon exit.
author: Amanda S.

description: I'm giving this place top stars, not only for their stunning wine selection and superior service (I love Jeff on Thursday nights -- LOVE him!), but for the little details, like pitted olives on the cheese plate. I love olives, but find pits messy. Why don't more classy joints pay attention to this?
author: Leslie F.

description:
I was walking down Fillmore and saw this cool, comfy spot where it looked chill enough where I could hear my friend and our conversation and not the thumping of bass but fun enough where we were around a cool crowd and good ambiance. Lucky enough for me it was open and we walked in and sat at these low cool chairs and glass tables and got some yummy wine.

I am gave four stars because I am not a wine snob and didn't know anything about the huge selection of wines they had by the glass. Maybe you really need to know wine to give it a full 5? Oh I don't know this whole crazy wine culture I just enjoy it and I enjoyed the Wine Bar!!!
author: Susie V.

description: I love this place, not because it is very close to my place but because every time I have gone here has been a great experience! The owner and the wine bartenders are very helpful in answering questions or recommending a great glass of wine. You can really describe what you want in a wine an they will help you in picking one! They have a great wine selection not just from Napa Valley but from Spain, Italy, France and Argentina & they all have a fabulous descriptions. When you go here make sure to order the Artisan Cheeses! :)
author: Valerie F.

description: This place is very cute.  I like the decor and atmosphere. Its a nice place to go if you want to sit down have a drink and actually have a conversation.  Unlike other places where your screaming in each others ears because the music is so loud.
author: Amanda B.

description: I love this place.  I have been here twice so far and it's been a great experience both times.  I love the location, the wine, the atmosphere and the cheese plate!  This wine bar is a true wine bar in the sense that they concentrate on the wine and not so much on the food - in fact, for food, they basically only have a cheese plate.  But, have no fear, they permit you to order food into the bar and enjoy it while you drink delicious wine.  They even have menu suggestions.  The first time I went, we did not eat or order, but we had a wonderful rioja.  The bartender recommended the rioja and it was really good.  I even bought a few bottles when I got back to NYC!  I went back recently (a year later), and found that although they not longer served the rioja, they had a lot of other great wines.  The bartender's recommendation was great and we ordered pizza into the bar.  I'm a big fan of this place.  5 Stars!
author: Divya M.

description: So glad we found this place! We went on a Saturday afternoon/early evening between films at the SFIFF and really enjoyed our time there.
author: Ann I.

description: Great wine bar, good descriptions on the wine menu. Found a few seats on a Saturday night and it was quiet enough to either watch the basketball game or just talk with a group. Great place for an after-dinner drink or with friends. I'd go back. Friendly staff and great selection.
author: Glaciala A.

description: I am such a fan!!!  I bring my dog and sit outside!!  It takes a while to get service outside so make sure you have a friend or ask someone to serve you outside.  The wines are amazing, the wine peeps really know their stuff and have never failed me on a recommendation.  Tues night they have a great deal on wine tasting.. definitely my fave night to take advantage as it isn't crowded, its romantic, and not expensive!!  They are heavy pourers too!!  yay!
author: blair k.

description: A perfectly fine wine bar.  Also they pour Nagy2 Syrah, which my high school friend Jon makes down in Santa Maria.
author: Beau G.

description: Went here for the first time last, have to say I'm not impressed.  It's a good looking space, but the wine selection left something to be desired.  It bothers me when places serve wines that I can buy at Safeway...so, you're going to charge me too much for something mediocre that I can get whenever? Sounds great!  Not surprising for this neighborhood, though.  Not many places to get a good glass of wine, except SPQR or Vivande.
author: Mr. Fist o.

description: This place is nothing to write home about..which then begs the question..why am I writing this review? Well, in case you're curious, I'd say this place is nice enough but not particularly memorable. There's kind of a weird lighting issue going on where parts of the place seem more lit than they should be, never a mistake you want to make with a bar. Staff is good, wine is good. If you're in the area, stop by, but don't make a special visit for this place.
author: Shreya C.

description: The Wine Jar is a comfortable, cozy and nice wine bar where you can enjoy any glass of wine that is on the menu whether you are a wine connoisseur or a wine amateur. The service is great and environment is very relaxed. It is a place where you can catch a break from the snobby feeling of pacific heights and go make yourself at home with some friends, wine, cheese and good music.
author: Michael B.

description: This is a great neighborhood wine bar. It's small but cute, there are a couple of larger tables but you're better off in smaller groups. The happy hour is pretty darn good (20% off bottles) and they have a great selection of wine. Try their cheese too, it's yummy! If you're in the neighborhood you should absolutely check it out, take a load off, and enjoy a nice glass of wine on one of their comfy couches or chairs!
author: Amber P.

description:
The wine craze has resulted in packed wine bars where wine is swilled and screaming conversations are the norm. I've certainly done my share of swilling and screaming but sometimes I'm really in the mood for a little quiet and Wine Jar is the closest place that provides the sort of peace of mind I crave from time to time. The place is on the small side but the space is open with the bar set in the back. The advantage is that there is more room for tables and couches and it also means that the waitress doesn't have to dodge folks who are cramped into narrow spaces so the service is more attentive. 
The crowd is a mix of neighborhood folks there to watch the game on the flat screen TV (one guy had a pizza delivered to the bar) and groups of friends who are happy to find a place to hang out with one another and catch up. 
The wine is reasonably priced and the selection is fairly diverse. The Maramonte 2005 Syrage was a great blend of rich, bold fruitness.
author: Richard S.

description: What can I say?  Trendy yet sterile atmosphere.  Servers know next to nothing about the wine they serve, and are inattentive.  Annoying music.  2 stars for the wine not being corked.
author: Richard M.

description:
3.5 stars. 
Happy Hour deal: 20% off bottles of wine from 4-7pm. 

Not a bad place to sip some vino at happy hour. It's a relaxed joint with good happy hour deals. I just wish the bartender was a little more attentive... he was nice once we got his attention but we were wondering what he was doing running back to the "kitchen" area all the time. Oh, and our bottle of white wine should have been kept on ice, right?
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Wine jar is a great spot to enjoy some wine alone or with friends.  The Malbec is amazing they pour btg and the bartender is very helpful and friendly!  I ordered a cheese plate as well and it was fabulous.....cheese was great and it ame with mixed nuts, olives and yummy wafer crackers.  This place is definitely a must try for anyone who has not been there yet.  It is tops on my list for where I will grab vino when I'm in the area.
author: Kimberly C.

description: Good wine + 2 blocks from my house = me constantly finding things to celebrate so I can treat myself to the Wine Jar. :)
author: Kourtney P.

description: The Wine Jar is a classy, chic little bar on Fillmore.  There are many white and red wine options as well as the choice to order a 1/2 glass, a glass, or bottle of your wine selection.  One can sit at the bar, on a comfy small couch, or a high rise table with bar stools.  The lights are dimmed low, and music playing in the background.  A perfect place to catch up with friends over a glass of wine, or take a date post dinner.
author: Caroline Q.

description: It's so close to being a great place.  But the lights are always too bright, and the service is always too slow.  Granted the wine is fabulous and I love love the cheese (its shaved) and olives.  Always grab some glasses before going to the Kabuki for a movie and it just needs to be more conscious of its atmosphere.  They need to lower the lights, turn up the music, and light some candles and then it would get 5 stars.
author: Em S.

description: I like it the first couple times I went and I definitely enjoy the wine list. But, I'm knocking a star off because the last time I was there I almost had to leave before finishing my glass because the grunge music was annoying the crap out of me. The owner/manager looks to be in his mid-30s and the early 90s were perhaps his glory days... But, really, Soundgarden is not a lovely accompaniment to my wine.
author: Leigh M.

description: Great service, the owner is friendly and provides excellent recommendations. They have a very delicious selection of wines. The pours are very generous. Great place to go to hang out, shoot the shit, and just have a good time.
author: Jun W.

description: I wasn't really wow-ed by Wine Jar. I did find a new (to me) Cabernet that I absolutely love but the place itself was just OK. The prices is OK. The service was OK. The wine list had a whole host of wines we'd never heard of - which is a big plus (two stars there) but I was a bit stumped by the very limited snack menu (you may have cheese or cheese or no cheese). It isn't too hard to add nuts and olives and other items not needing cooking for people who just are not in a cheesy mood.
author: Sarcastic T.

description: What's up with attitude at this place? My husband and I went here to grab a glass of wine after dinner this weekend. It's close to our place, we'd been there once before and had a decent experience. We got there and sat ourselves near the door and sat there for a good 10 minutes. It was pretty cold out and having the door propped wide open seemed a little silly so when I saw the waiter I asked him if it would be ok to close the door. His response was that the bartenders are hot behind the bar. REALLY?! SERIOUSLY?! Well as long as the bartenders are comfortable, who cares about the customers who keep the place open! Needless to say, we didn't get our drink there and I will never be going back again. Terrible service, bad attitude. There are plenty of places that have a wider selection and are much more friendly.
author: Betsy E.

description: I went here recently to meet a friend - actually someone that I met at the Wine Enthusiasts Event at the Opera House and armed with the expectations to enjoy wine, we certainly did that!  This place is great; small and intimate and the staff pays you just enough attention without hovering
author: Rich N.

description: Good wine selection, excellent service, but an odd, book-club like crowd brought down the sex appeal of the place. maybe the lights needed to be turned down a bit.
author: kaizar C.

description: I'm claiming this as my friendly neighborhood wine bar. I highly recommend ordering half -glasses as they pour generously (and you get more bang for your buck if you want to sample a few different wines) . It's chill, it has good prices, good vibes. Nuff said.
author: nancy k.

description: Really cozy and comfortable inside. I'm a fan of Harry's but it's great to have a new addition to the 'hood. I had a few glasses of the Bordeaux recommended by our server - great recommendation. We ordered a cheese plate which was nothing too impressive but something decent to snack on. I look forward to going back and checking out more of the wines - I went on a Tuesday and it never got crowded at all...it's pretty small so I'm guessing it can get crowded. But on a weeknight it was perfect...
author: Kate S.

description: Newly remodeled from an old Trio Cafe to a Wine mini lounge. About seven bar stools and couchette seating for various mini groupings of four or six. Think quaint, teeny, wine bar. It's nice and on cold nights, just wish they had some kind of dark brown velvet curtain to contain the whooshing cold air from blasting you when you sit at the couch by the door. Preferred the bar stools just for the draftiness factor. It is small and intimate and not meant for HUGE bridge and tunnel crowders. Best wishes...had hoped you might have named it something a little more refined than "jar"..."Jar Jar" is just a little floppy, looking like a kangaroo, but hey, just IMHO.
author: miriam b.

description: doesn't "wow" me. Good, not great wine, and I had to wait a long time for a menu (15-20 min). I've only been twice out of convenience. Once was while waiting for a table at SPQR. I know that is horrible to say, but it served its purpose well. It is pricey and that is to be expected but I feel like the service and menu should be more established, at least when charging that much. And I hate the height of the chairs for the tables. I think that uncomfortable hunching or twisting around the table is keeping me away.
author: Webber B.

description: Went to this place after a movie at the Kabuki. It was a get together for the filmmakers of D Tour and the band that the movie was about. The place was crowded but the service was stellar and the wine selection is impressive. I loved the wine I tried.  The bartender encouraged me to take a pic with my phone to remember the name. Wish I had my home computer to post it here. There is also beer and bottled seltzer water available. It is very minimalistic decor. There are some great photos on the wall but they are very dark.  There is a photo of the boat in Inverness. It is the darkest photo I have ever seen of the boat.
author: erin k.

description: I was very impressed with this wine bar.  I was looking for something low key and somewhere my husband and I could easily sit and chat - this was the place.  The wine selection was great.  The ambiance is nice.
author: Rise G.

description: Wine Jar is a fantastic addition to the Fillmore!  It has a great vibe and they offer an amazing selection of wines.  All of the servers were very helpful and the owner was gracious and attentive.  This will be the best wine bar in SF!
author: Marco C.

description: The place itself is nice, the seating, the lighting. But whoever that guy was, owner/bartender, he ruins the experience by acting so snobby. Not a hello, not a smile, go grab your own menus type of thing, Honestly, people who works/own places like this should be more welcoming, especially given the wine selection by the glass is pretty slim. Seriously no French wines, no Italian wines?
author: Anna B.

description: Huge wine list, decent ambiance. The lounge is chill and relaxing... good for unwinding.  Service was a bit slow even though we sat at the bar.  They had free Whoppers in a giant wine glass on the counter so I took full advantage while waiting.  Probably will come by again after the movies at Kabuki someday, but not a place I would make a special trip out for.
author: Mischen C.

description: I've been saying since we moved to Pac Heights that Fillmore Street needed a wine bar. All we had for a drink on Fillmore was Harry's really. Meeting friends for dinner on Fillmore? Well, you've finally got a place to go for a drink first - especially if there's a super long wait at SPQR and you need to kill time somewhere. I met my friend here last weekend and was really happy. Mellow, comfy environment, good vino, nice service. Gets the job done!
author: Sarah R.

description: I have been here twice recently and really enjoyed myself both times.  The owner Kamran is incredibly knowledgeable about wine and cheese.  He is a really nice guy, and goes out of his way to make sure his guests are happy and well taken care of.  Definitely a nice change from the usual places where they just can't be bothered.  I will definitely continue to hang out here!
author: Jen C.

description: Way too loud. The place was not crowded at all yet I was screaming at my friend all night to be heard. They should seriously invest in the acoustics in this room. It's exactly the kind of place you want to go to talk with friends but you can't because it is horribly LOUD.
author: Jenn M.

description: I like this place. It isn't well known - yet although I am sure Yelp will change that - and I can always find a seat, table what have you. Wine selection is not the best of the wine bars in the city but it is decent and well priced. It is a good place to get drinks with girlfriends.
author: Jessica K.

description: Checked Wine Jar out on a random weeknight. Great space/decor and music. Wasn't too crowded and unfortunately missed the happy hour deal which was a nice 20% off bottles. Had a bottle of cab and the cheeseplate both good. Would return again.
author: Monica P.

description: Yes it's a bit small, but it's cozy.  Went there with a friend and lucked out with a small table right by the door.  The arctic chill every time the door opened kept my wine cool, but perhaps with a door curtain, they could rectify that easily.  The wine list is balanced and well priced, but don't go there for food as there are only a few cheeses offered.  Gotta give props to our new neighborhood wine bar as it now gives us an option other than Harry's.  Great spot for a date if you can find a cozy spot to sink into.
author: Louis M.

description:
This place seems to have so much potential but isn't quite there yet.  A few suggestions: 
- Swap the music for something more Thievery Corporation-ish - will set more of a wine bar tone (right now the music is more classic rock/blues, which doesn't set the right mood)
- Scrap the TV screen (is it a wine bar or sports bar? - the TV ruins the wine bar vibe)
- Slightly better service.  The place was not busy the night we were there but we ended up ordering at the bar b/c the guy doing table service was watching the TV.

The wine itself is pretty good - a good variety, OK prices.  It's the atmosphere that isn't quite right (for us at least).  We'd definitely come back again but hope to see some changes.
author: Maggie L.

description: This was a nice surprise on a Saturday afternoon stroll down Fillmore Street.  It was a beautiful day, so we sat outside and had a bottle of pinot, which was okay but not great.  Server was nice and it was fun watching people.  Music was odd: hard rock coming from a Fillmore Street wine bar.  It lightened up a bit after awhile.  And no, I'm not some old coot that likes elevator music!  I'll definitely go back to check out the experience on an evening inside.
author: Kevin M.

description: In a wine savvy city, it's baffling this place is still in business. After three unfortunate visits (friend's insistence on a convenient pre-dinner meeting place), I am convinced this is the worst wine bar in SF. The wines are over-priced, uninteresting, and generally difficult to choke down. Mostly, I think this place buys cheap no-name branded wines so they can fleece customers for $10 glasses of wine. The white wines are too cold and red wines are served too hot. It's also small, poorly lit, and loud. Staff are well-intentioned, but clueless. So, if you really don't care about wine at all or what goes down your gullet, you'll enjoy this place.
author: Arm H.

description: There has certainly been a dearth of places to grab a drink and relax on Fillmore, and so I am really happy about  the Wine Jar.  They have a couch and a nice atmosphere, and Cameron (the owner) is very cool.
author: Dan S.

description: No complaints about this place, comfy seating, good list of wine glasses, clean bathrooms. the waiters could be a little more attentive, but hey, after a few drinks who knows
author: Rich B.

description: Wow, great wine list! Love the variation, and the prices aren't exorbitant either. The server was very good about recommending things I might like, and even suggested a Marlborough sauvignon blanc that had been taken off the menu that I ended up really liking. People trickled in after 5 (this was a Wednesday) and I imagine it's packed on weekends; I can see why. I'd happily go back. The happy hour special on the night I went was 50% off bottles.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Wonderful wine, wonderful atmosphere and wonderful owner!
We went late on a sunday night and it was still a little busy there. The owner is a very nice gentleman who stood and talked with us throughout most of our staff, very fine etiquette that you do not see very often.
After a few rounds, our table at Dosa was ready and we left. If not for our previously made reservation, we probably would have stayed at Wine Jar until it closed!
Looking forward to sitting outside and sipping wine on fillmore when summertime comes around.
I will be back, again and again.
author: David L.

description: I recently moved to the neighborhood and am happy I found this place. Great service & simple but nice wine selection.  The cheese plate is super yummy and is served with a variety of olives and mixed nuts.
author: Tambo T.

description: Great Wine, Excellent Service, Love the Atmosphere!
author: jeanne l.

description: I guess you could say we're regulars at this point. We love the atmosphere, the owner, his staff, and their extremely generous Tuesday tastings... Um, hello! Four full pourings for $15... That's unheard of. And, we live nearby. Keep doing what you're doing, Wine Jar. 90s Music and all. :)
author: Ginny Z.

description: Very nice place to grab a glass of wine.  Staff is super friendly.  One big problem, place is REALLY small, so it is hard to have a drink with a group because there is only really one main area that can seat a big group and im sure u need to get there early to snag it.  Its a nice addition to the fillmore street, esp if you are waiting in line for some rests. to come over and grab a quick drink.
author: Charles C.

description: Small wine bar. Decent wine selection by the glass or bottle. Some nights they have a HH special of 50% off bottles of wine. Can get crowded fairly quickly.
author: Jennifer T.

description: There are many things I love about The Wine Jar: its proximity to my apt, an endless stream of the music I love, the plethora of wine choices and the unpretentious service. Wine Jar is located in what I would describe as a mini-strip mall on Fillmore (I think it's jammed between a nail shop and a florist). When the arctic winds aren't blowing up from the water, there are usually a few tables sprinkled around in front. I have never seated myself out there, so I can't make an accurate comment on what the service is like should you choose to take in a little fresh air with your fortifications. Wine Jar's menu is fairly extensive when it comes to non-snobby establishments such as this. They even have a decent selection of beers. As far as wine goes, I have tried several but find myself going back to the Twenty Rows 2006 Merlot and the Maramonte 2005 Syrage. At first, the service at Wine Jar might seem a little lacking since the staff doesn't get right up in your grill the second you sit down. The atmosphere at Wine Jar is very laid back, and they give you some time to settle in, make a decision and get the conversation going. If for some reason you are in a time crunch, you can go up to the bar yourself or politely get the attention of someone who works there. Wine Jar is not a good place for a large group unless you plan on renting the entire place out. It's a great place to bring a date if you don't mind sitting close to each other to hear and talk over the music, or a couple friends before heading off to dinner. There are a few lounges that accommodate 'larger' parties, otherwise there are a few small tables and the bar. The first time I went to the Wine Jar I fell in love with it because every song they played could be found on my own iPod. It turns out they just run a certain Pandora station, but I wasn't disappointed, as long as they kept up the jams. Heavy on the rotation were The Killers, Modest Mouse, Death Cab, etc. They do have a happy hour, but I'm never out of work in time to enjoy it, so I can't help you out there. So, WIne Jar is a great place to start the night but don't plan on it being your only stop, or if you plan on having a low key evening, you could easily pass a few hours there.
author: Breanna L.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood, Wine Jar!

We found you on Yelp and you were part of our master plan for last night...put our name on the waiting list at SPQR and then come to you to while away the two hour wait we had been quoted (grr)

Great ambiance.  I can't even picture Trio Cafe anymore...dark grey walls, black and chocolate brown leather furnishings, black granite bar top, very sleek yet still cozy; not cold at all.  Good lighting.  VERY important to have good lighting.

The owner(one of the owners?), Cameron, was our bartender and he was quite knowledgeable, friendly and conversational.  The wine was delicious.  We were offered as many tastes as necessary to determine which one we each wanted.

I agree with another Yelper that this neighborhood needed this.  And with another Yelper that gives 4 star automatically to ANYONE who gets a business opened in this town...it's tough out there people!
Even though the neighborhood needed this, they have to be GOOD to keep my business.  Wine Jar is.
author: Jill C.

description:
Laid-back, chilled atmosphere, good selection of wines, and the staff seemed to know their stuff (which is handy as I don't). The T-Vine Zinfandel, mentioned in a couple of reviews already, was excellent...much nicer than the pricier Chateauneuf-du-Pape we also tried. French wine, PAH!

It's very small, I imagine it probably gets very cosy indeed at the weekend...not necessarily a bad thing.
author: James B.

description: Great atmosphere, decent list, fabulous staff!
author: Thomas W.

description: I met a friend for drinks at this adorable wine bar on Fillmore street- although from the outside it looks like part of a strip mall- the inside is warm and welcoming. Large glasses of wine small snacks and great atmosphere- depending on when you go the shrieking level of voices can be high, thats when you just order another and after a few glasses you are the loud one.
author: Sarah C.

description:
opened about 4 months ago, i have to say that this is a semi decent wine lounge ... coming from the marina, i have to say, i really really liked the fact how it wasn't super packed, and that you were able to HEAR the other person ... AND that ppl actually came IN HERE to enjoy the other person's company ... unlike nectar, you can come in here with casual attire and be comfortable ... 

the service was a bit slow, and there wasn't a whole lotta folks to begin with ... the place is cute and small, and they offer a fair amount of wine in 3 simple selections: 1/2 glass, a reg glass and a bottle .. i also loved how the interior had this earthy tone making it comfy ... and LAST BUT NOT LEAST, i have to say, i was really happy with the selection of music ... they PLAYED movie scores, and one of my ALL TIME FAVORITE ARTISTS... *dun dun dun* E-N-Y-A! most ppl can't appreciate enya, but i do ... and that made my experience SO much better ...

ooo ... how it soothes the soul ...

just needs a lil bit of work, then it'll be all good ...
author: Jennifer S.

description:
this place is great! really comfy, cozy vibe, very romantic spot. my only complaint was that they kept propping the door open (even though we closed it a few times), and the cold air coming in definitely detracted from the coziness and made it quite chilly. 
but with the door closed it's a 5-star place!
author: Sarah Y.

description: Every neighborhood needs a wine bar, and lucky for Filmore Street they got a good one!  The wine list is nice and seems to have something for everyone... although better descriptions of the wines would be great, they were a bit vague.  But the vagueness wasn't so much a problem because the staff seems very knowledgeable and even gives you a generous taste if you're unsure about your choice.  The ambiance is great... very stylish and I like the zig-zag bar.  I also love the artwork, which I'm assuming is local and possibly will change.  My only other complaint, and this is a minor one, would be for them to expand their snack menu and offer a better cheese assortment.  Although we didn't order bites ourselves, someone next to us did and the presentation looked a bit lacking.  The owner himself, Cameron, served us and was very friendly and eager to please.  He has done a fantastic job with the space and with all this taken into consideration I will be back for a repeat visit.
author: Ms. M. M.

description: Really Yelpers!?!?!?  thought this was an overpriced, overly noisy wine bar with a very mediocre selection.  Quite simple, this place is trying to hard in ALL the wrong ways.
author: Jane M.

description: I love the wine jar!   This is a great place to catch up with a friend and enjoy an opportunity to lounge with a glass of wine.  The wine selection is abundant and the bartenders have excellent recommendations if you tell them what you like.  Sparkling, red, white, dessert wine, beer . . . you can find it all.   It's a pretty small place but there is comfortable seating to accommodate any size group, although I think it is more suitable for small groups.  If you want to have a mellow night and enjoy a place where you can actually carry on a conversation, this is a great option.
author: Brenna C.

description: with the lack of bars on fillmore street (you can only go to harry's so many times), it was nice to see wine jar open up. the staff is quite knowledgeable and they have a good selection of wines from here and abroad. two negatives, it's not very big (so get there early if you don't want to stand in the middle of the floor) and they only offer cheese plates so far (i hear small plates were coming soon). but it is a great place to meet friends after work or have a glass of wine while waiting for a table at SPQR.
author: kim m.

description: A favorite when I'm in the area, if they'd lose the boob tube I say 4-stars.  TV's do not belong in wine bars folks, stay home or got to a sports bar if you want to watch TV!
author: jason m.

description: i was very happy w/ wine jar.  we had a lil leftover time between dinner and our movie so we all came in here for a glass.  the setting is nice and the owners have made the most of the small space.  it didn't feel cramped and the seating was well thought out.  the menu is pretty nice though i forget exactly what i got.  the staff was friendly and i wouldn't mind coming back for a glass if i'm hanging in the area.
author: Swarup B.

description: I was up in the city visiting some family & friends. I had heard about the Wine Jar. When I arrived it was kizmit. Parking right in front! Have to say - GREAT PLACE!!  The owner sat and talked with me & my family. Perfect host. Amazing amazing amazing wine. I am now in love with Malbec. The decor is very nicely done. I recommend it to all my pals that live in the city and the ones that are visiting. Easy, casual classy!  Nicely done. Very Impressed.
author: BB S.

description: Cozy, yet chic-enough spot with comfy tables and seating.  Nice selection of wines.  Good happy hour deal.  Great neighborhood type of place, but a little out of the way for happy hour or random weekday mtgs.  Relatively limited parking, but what else is new in Pac Hts.
author: T D.

description: We're big fans of Cameron and Wine Jar.  Great wine selection and atmosphere in a comfortable neighborhood place.
author: Dave D.

description: I think this bar is very cute but it is pretty small.  We sat near a table of 6 who were screaming which, needless to say, was a little distracting.  I would like to go again on a weeknight.  If it is not too crowded I bet it would be really fun.
author: Marie N.

description: I give this a 5ver and I'll tell you why.  First off, it is almost impossible to open a business in San Fransisco.  Between Planning, DBI, Community Out Reach, ABC, and City Hall as a whole, anyone trying to open a business now starts out with 4 stars.  I like the charming and polite people that work there as opposed to the attitude you get everywhere else in the City.  My wife LOVES the wine list and she's a total wine snob.  I LOVE the small intimate space and when it gets crowded, Wine Jar reminds me of all the tiny joints I hang out in in London.  I wish this place the best of luck and will support it with all I've got.  This place is a rarity in the City.
author: Frank B.

description: The Wine Jar is a classy and hip place to enjoy a glass of wine. It's clear that the owner is a pro at the business, and has taken every little detail into account when designing this place. The dark floors and dim lighting offer a very intimate setting and although the place is not very large, it is stocked with a great selection of domestic and imported wines and beer. The staff is very knowledgeable and attentive. On Friday and Saturday nights you will find an upscale professional crowd . It's a great pace to grab a drink before or after dinner on Fillmore.   I've been here two weekends in a row and will surely return.
